title: Distance Savvy: Testing Tele-Savvy, a Distance Dementia Family Caregiver Education Program
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to refine and test the web-based delivery of a well-established in-person group program that provides information and education to informal caregivers (family and friends) of persons with Alzheimer's disease (or related illnesses).
description_detailed: The pilot project proposed will allow the investigators to use telehealth methods to deliver the Savvy Caregiver, an evidence-based dementia caregiver psychoeducation program, to family caregivers of community-dwelling persons with dementing illnesses (PWD) for whom attending in-person meetings poses difficulties. The program - named Tele-Savvy - uses iPad and PC technology and on-line conferencing capacity to deliver the program through daily asynchronous self-learning modules and weekly, hour-long synchronous group meetings with program facilitators. Tele-Savvy addresses all of the learning objectives of the current in-person Savvy program (Savvy entails in-person participation in six weekly two-hour group sessions).
explanation_target: Reason: The described study evaluates a web-based delivery of the Savvy Caregiver psychoeducation program (Tele‑Savvy) — an educational/behavioral intervention for informal caregivers of people with Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias. This is not testing a drug, biologic, or a cognitive-enhancing pharmacologic agent. citeturn0search5turn0search0

Act: Key extracted details — Intervention name: Tele‑Savvy (Distance Savvy trial NCT02300584). Delivery: daily brief video lessons plus weekly synchronous group videoconference sessions (iPad/online). Purpose: refine and test web-based delivery of an evidence-based in‑person caregiver education program (Savvy Caregiver). All primary/secondary outcomes relate to caregiver use, stress, burden, and related measures rather than pharmacologic or disease-modifying endpoints. citeturn0search5turn0search2

Act (cont.): Multiple published evaluations describe Tele‑Savvy/online Savvy Caregiver as a psychoeducational program that reduces caregiver burden, depressive symptoms, and improves caregiver mastery — reinforcing that the intervention is behavioral/educational.
